loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат жительница района Дж. Руми. Ей 55 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее дети работают. Сама Каромат занимается торговлей. Она уже год как занимается продажей продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Каромат просит кредит для покупки овощей и продуктов с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Karomat lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 55 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom work. Karomat is engaged in retail: for the past year, she has been selling food and household goods. She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables and other products in order to increase the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and household products in order to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. Баходур хочет заняться животноводством. Он намерен закупить крупнорогатый скот и начать свой бизнес. Для этого ему необходима финансовая поддержка. Баходур обратился в нашу организацию, чтобы получить кредит для закупа бычков и коровы.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in the Jilikul region. He is 25 years old and married. Bahodur would like to launch his own livestock business. He is planning to purchase cattle, but for this he needs financial support. Thus, he has turned to MLO Humo & Partners to obtain a loan for purchasing calves and a cow.

loans.use: to purchase calves and a cow

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio que pertenece al departamento de León, en él habita Carla Patricia, una madre joven de tres hijas, se gana la vida impartiendo clases a niños de primaria, de las muchas que hay en dicho municipio con una profesión  merecedora y motivante porque gracias a estas personas hoy se han forjado grandes profecionales que contribuyen al desarrollo de Nicaragua.

Uno de sus grandes logros y sueños es que está a punto de culminar su carrera profesional como es el de maestra de primaria y para ello está llevando a cabo los módulos para obtener su título de profesionalización por lo que en esta etapa se requiere de mucho dinero para pagar fotocopias, impresiones, pasajes para viajar hasta la ciudad donde está ubicada la universidad, por este motivo está solicitando este crédito para pagar estos gastos en dichos módulos y así obtener su título de maestra.

Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado por KIVA y Ceprodel al otorgarle este crédito sera de gran ayuda porque con su bajo salario no podria llevar a cabo este proceso y que en un futuro viene a mejorar su condición de vida tanto para su familia como para ella, ya que con su título como profesional le valoran más su salario por el nivel académico.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful town belonging to León Department.  Carla Patricia lives there.  She’s a young mother of three daughters.  She earns her living teaching elementary school children of which there are many in said town; her profession is worthy and motivating because thanks to these people great professionals who are the country’s developers have been formed.

One of her great accomplishments and dreams is that she’s about to complete her professional training as an elementary school teacher and to do so is taking several blocks of courses to attain her degree which means that during this stage she needs much money to pay for photocopies, printing and transportation costs to the city where the university is located.  Because of this she’s requesting this loan to pay for the expenses related to said course blocks to get her teaching degree.

She feels very grateful for the support she’s gotten from Kiva and Ceprodel by granting this loan which will be a big help because her salary wouldn’t be enough to carry out this process that in the future will lead to improved living conditions not only for her family but for her too because with a professional degree her salary will be higher due to her academic level.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, underwear and various items.

loans.name: Jeenny Amparo

texts.es:
Jeenny, vive con su familia, es divorciada, administra un negocio junto a su hermana ofreciendo productos comestibles como galletas, boquitas, dulces, bebidas, ella inició este negocio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de sostenimiento y de ingresos para su familia.

Actualmente necesita comprar mercadería para fortalecer la tienda, por eso solicita préstamo que le permita comprarse boquitas, dulces, galletas, pan, productos de cocina, ya que esto aumentará su inventario y mejorará la vistosidad a los clientes.

Ella tiene por objetivo, trabajar honradamente para poder tener la fuente de ingreso que hasta el momento le ha permitido cubrir todos sus gastos, espera crecer a través de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Jeenny is divorced, lives with her family, and manages a business with her sister selling food products like cookies, snacks, sweets and drinks. She started this business out of the necessity to have a source of sustenance and income for her family.

Right now she needs to buy goods to strengthen the shop, so she is requesting a loan that would allow her to buy snacks, sweets, cookies, bread and cooking products, as this would increase her inventory and improve her visibility to customers.

Her objective is to work honestly to have a source of income that until now has allowed her to cover her expenses. She hopes to grow through the aid of loans.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candy, cookies, bread, cooking products.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad, ella es soltera y vive en Sololá.  Junto a sus padres y algunos hermanos trabajan y contribuyen a la economía de la familia.
Ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar ya que desde que era niña no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en la escuela por que sus padres no tenían la posibilidad económica. Ella aprendió a elaborar prendas típicas femeninas que usan en su pueblo y a trabajar en el campo de la agricultura.
Ahora ella fabrica artículos de perlas de fantasía como pulseras, cinturones, collares, aretes para entregarle a un acreedor mayorista en su comunidad que siempre le hace pedidos.
Esto lo aprendió de sus hermanas la cual realizaban este trabajo, con el pasar de los años ella decide ser independiente fabricando sus propios productos. Ella obtiene una ganancia aceptable mejorando los ingresos de la familia, ahora tiene  6 años fabricando estos artículos.
Motivo por la cual ve que los pedidos aumentan por la temporada del año y necesita un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar  perlas de fantasía de diferentes colores he hilo para seguir fabricando mas artículos y cumplir con los pedidos de su acreedor.
Ampliar su negocio es su mayor sueño entregando pedidos a más acreedores en su comunidad apoyando a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 25-year-old hardworking woman. She is single and she lives in Sololà. Together with her parents and some of her brother’s activities, her job helps contributing to their family’s economy.
She has always loved working ever since she was a child. She did not have the chance to study because her parents did not have the necessary economic means. She has then learned how to make the typical female clothes that are worn in her village and also how to engage in farming.
She now creates glass pearls items such as bracelets, birds, necklaces and earrings to give them to a wholesaler customer of her community that is constantly placing orders with her.
She has learned this activity from her sisters, as they were engaged in this activity as well. After a few years she decided to become independent by making her own products. She earns an acceptable income, thus improving her family’s earnings, and she has now been engaged in making these articles for 6 years.
Having notice that at this time of years there is an increase in the requests she receives, she is asking for a loan of Q 4,000.00 to buy glass pearls in different colors and thread to keep on creating more article and to satisfy all of her customers’ requests.
Her biggest dream is to expand her activity, selling products to more customers of her community, in order to help improving her family’s strand of living.

loans.use: To buy thread and glass pearls to create her jewels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 300 sacks of organic manure to start planting corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle helmets, vests, luxury accessories and self-adhesive paper.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rpsario Group

texts.es:
El comité “Virgen del Rosario” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Santaní, las 13 mujeres se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral.
Geronima es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella desea poder ayudar a sus familiares y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz, balanceados, y demás tipos de alimentos para animales. El grupo agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, ya que sus familias serán muy bien ayudadas.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Rosario Communal Bank was formed when several neighbors and friends in the city of Santani came together. The thirteen women raise and sell barnyard animals.

Geronima is a very hardworking person who is making an effort to get ahead and help her family. She wants to be able to help her family members and give them a decent life without hardships. She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, nutritional feed and other kinds of animal feed. 

The members of the group are grateful for the help they are receiving because it will greatly help their families.

loans.use: to purchase corn and other kinds of animal feed.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Madres Emprendedoras son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo son 14 mujeres muy alegres y contentas con el grupo que formaron y el cual guían con mucha responsabilidad, todas juntas.
Lucia vende frutas de todo tipo, y cuenta que tiene clientela muy variada, que siempre compra de ella, es por eso que le va bien. Está recibiendo mucho apoyo de sus compañeras del grupo, y eso la motiva a seguir luchando para dar lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas, como ser manzanas, bananas, sandias, melones, peras y demás, para poder seguir dando una buena cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Madres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Mothers) committee is from San Lorenzo.  It has 14 very cheerful members who are very happy with the group they formed and which they guide together very responsibly.

Lucía sells all types of fruit.  She comments that she has a diverse clientele that always buys from her which is why she does well.  She’s getting support from her fellow group members and this motivates her to continue striving to provide the best for her family.

She’s requesting the loan to buy fruit like apples, bananas, watermelons, pears and others to continue providing a good amount of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy all types of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda is 44 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Raymunda has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Raymunda requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Raymunda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Raymunda would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 44-year-old active, married woman.  She has been doing a business of embroidery at her home for the last five years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members. She makes enough to lead a decent life while her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the household's everyday expenditures.

She is a loving mother of six children.  She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health, and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she is requesting for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase a stock of threads and packs of sequins, glitters etc. in different colors to complete customers' orders on time. She expects more profits and hence be able to better support her family. She desires to spend part of the income on providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads and packs of sequins, glitters etc. in different colors.

loans.name: Emmanuel Baco Group

texts.en:
Justine, 64, is a widow with ten children aged between 28 and 49 years old. She has been a part of the micro-enterprise world since 1962 and is the chairwoman of the Emmanuel BACO community bank. Through this bank nine members are united in solidarity with the goal of developing their businesses through Kiva loans.

Justine operates a general store located to the northeast of Lubumbashi and makes $150 USD a month. She has acquired solid skills and experience managing her store. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so as to achieve her goals.

Justine is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having ten times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her group is applying for a 6,000 USD loan, of which she will take a portion. With it she will increase her stock of merchandise by buying canned foods, sacks of rice, soap, sugar, milk and dozens of prepaid phone cards.

Justine’s ambition is to open a larger store in Lubumbashi one day and so achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to increase her store's stock of merchandise.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas Trabajadoras,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, actualmente están en su segundo ciclo, y comentan que desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Isabelina, una de las miembros, se dedica  a la costura; y comenta que este es su medio de ayudar a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y con grandes ansias de sentirse útil y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las confecciones que vende.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas Trabajadoras” (United Hardworking Women) is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Itá.  They are currently in their second cycle and want to be able to reach the program’s highest level and by means of their work help their families.

Isabelina is one of the members.  She’s a seamstress and she comments that this is her method for helping her family.  She’s a very hardworking person with a strong desire to feel useful and by means of her work to help her family.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other supplies to be able to continue making the articles of clothing she sells.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and others.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este Comité de 21 mujeres trabajadoras es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, las miembros son mujeres que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y enfrentan todo tipo de desafíos. Una de ellas es Asteria, quien cuenta que gracias a la venta de leche que hace está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Cuenta Asteria que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas para poder llevar a sus clientes la leche para la hora del desayuno. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual quiere poder tener un buen stock de ese producto. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas las miembros.
texts.en:
This group of 21 working women is from the city of Coronel Oviedo.  The members are women who make every effort to get ahead and are up against all kinds of challenges to do so.  One of them is Asteria, who claims that thanks to selling milk she is getting ahead and helping her family.  Asteria says she works every day from very early in the morning to take milk to her customers by breakfast time.  She wants to continue expanding and helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk so she will have a good inventory available.  She is grateful for the opportunity all the members of the group are receiving.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra, administra una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, ella vive con su padre y cuatro hermanos de las edades de 24, 20, 18 y 14 años, este negocio de Sandra consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como lo es arroz frijol y azúcar y tiene tres años de experiencia, lo aprendió de su padre quien le ayuda a atender el negocio, su horario es a tiempo completo.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo para realizar la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frutas, verduras, aceite, entre otros que son necesarios para que pueda incrementar el negocio y mejore sus ventas.

Quiere tener un negocio más fortalecido espera que a través del préstamo pueda realizar sus objetivos, actualmente es bachiller pero aspira continuar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Sandra manages a grocery store.  She lives with her father and four siblings aged 24, 20, 18 and 14.  Sandra’s business consists in selling basic staples like rice, beans and sugar.  She has three years’ experience having learned from her father who helps her tend to the business; she works full-time.

She’s asking for a loan to buy foodstuffs like rice, beans, sugar, fruit, vegetables and oil, among others that are necessary for her to be able to expand the business and improve sales.  She wants to have a more strengthened business and hopes to be able to reach her objectives by means of the loans.  
She’s a high-school graduate and hopes to continue with her university studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, fruit, vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Alba Morena

texts.es:
Alba, se dedica a la venta de detergentes, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica vendiendo detergentes de todo tipo lo hace con las amas de casa y empleados, realiza la venta de forma ambulante, también les provee detergente algunas tiendas pequeñas de sus alrededores.

Ella necesita un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra por mayor de rinso, jabón en barra, shampoo, jabón líquido, ya que esto le dará la fortaleza para continuar ofreciendo a los clientes y así satisfacer las necesidades de ellos, teniendo más surtido el negocio.

La aspiración de ella es colaborar con todos sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos en variedad y de buena calidad, ya que esto le dará una mejor seguridad en el mercado y en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alba sells detergents.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She works selling all types of detergent to housewives and employees.  She sells from place to place and also supplies detergent to some small nearby stores.

She needs a loan to buy Rinso, bar soap, shampoo and liquid soap at wholesale because this will give her the means to have better variety on stock to continue selling to her customers thus meeting their needs.  Her hope is to collaborate with all her customers by selling them a variety of good quality products because this will give her business better market and income security.

loans.use: to buy Rinso, bar soap, shampoo and liquid soap at wholesale.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is 57 years old, married, and has six grown children. She has been operating a charcoal selling business for the last four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. With the support of the loan, she will be able to increase the size of her business and earn more of an income. 

Her dream is to continue working to succeed in her business. One of the challenges that she faces is theft of her product. She enjoys spending her free time at home.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Twalyn

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 21,000 pesos, Twalyn ha podido comprar 1  saco de arroz, 1 lata de aceite, pasta, frijoles, leche y refrescos para su tienda de comestibles. Twalyn es soltera y vive con sus padres. Nunca le ha gustado la idea de ser empleada, por esto con los ahorros obtenidos en su tiempo de empleada compró esta pequeña tienda de venta de comestibles. Hace 2 años que es propietaria de su propio negocio, y aunque han habido momentos difíciles, pues la economía está muy inestable, se siente contenta de haber tomado esta decisión.
Con el tiempo que tiene con el negocio entiende que ya pasó el proceso de curva de aprendizaje, por lo que sus planes futuros son comenzar a introducir mayor variedad y oferta de mercancía a sus clientes, con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos y fortalecer financieramente la tienda
texts.en:
With a 21,000 peso loan Twalyn has been able to buy one sack of rice, one can of oil, pasta, beans, milk and soft-drinks for her grocery store.  Twalyn is single living with her parents.  She’s never liked the idea of working for others which is why she used the savings she earned working as an employee to buy this small grocery store.  She’s been a business owner for two years and although there have been some trying times because the economy is very unstable she feels happy with the decision she made.

She’s gone through the learning curve in the time she’s been in business so her future plan is to start introducing a wider variety of merchandise to offer her customers aiming at increasing her income and strengthen the store financially.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, a can of oil, pasta, beans, milk and soft-drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gafur

texts.en:
Gafur is 54 years old and married. He sells home products to earn a living. He has been in the business for 10 years. Through the financial support from friends, he has managed to grow his business. 

He dreams of expanding his business and becoming prosperous in the future. He needs a loan to of USD 3,000 to buy home products to sell. He will look forward to your help.

loans.use: To buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Azizan

texts.en:
Azizan is a 53-year-old married woman. Her husband is employed in a small factory, yet his income alone is insufficient to fulfill the needs of his wife and five children.

Azizan has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. Her store is stocked with various goods for daily use. She has a large, regular clientele that prefer shopping with her because she always carries what they need at reasonable prices.

Azizan is motivated to provide for her family, and her earnings contribute a lot to the family income. As she wants to grow her business, she is applying for a loan of 45,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation (she has already repaid six prior loans with no difficulty). She will use the funds to buy stocks of rice and flour for her shop from the marketplace at lower rates. She would not only profit this way but would be able to meet her customers’ needs consistently.

Azizan wishes to use her profits to deal with personal expenses and increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour for her shop from the marketplace at lower rates.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Yede, de 28 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Fredy, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Lisbeth, Juan Carlos y Luzmila a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Como toda mujer del campo, trabajadora y con aspiraciones. Comienza sus días en los campos, cuidando de sus sembríos de maíz, alverja y papa. Los cuales le brindan el único sustento económico para su familia. Las ganas de trabajar de está mujer son extraordinarios; pues su última hija tiene unos meses de nacida y necesita muchos cuidados. Su esposo la ayuda en los trabajos forzados, cargando los sacos de alimentos en la cosecha y trasladando los animales que cría a la feria de Acostambo, los días viernes; donde ella recibe un dinero extra con la venta de las ovejas y vacas, que cría durante muchos meses. Ahora desea tener un negocio donde pueda obtener una ganancia adicional. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “tancar puquio”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Yede, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales vacunos y ovinos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yede, 28, is an unassuming woman living with Fredy, her husband of seven years.  They have three children: Lisbeth, Juan Carlos and Luzmila who they care for in their own house.  Like all hardworking, hopeful women of the land she starts her day in the fields caring for her corn, pea and potato crops that provide her family’s only source of income.  This woman’s will to work is extraordinary for her youngest daughter is only a few months old and needs much care.  

Her husband helps her with the most demanding tasks like carrying the sacks of animal feed and the sacks of harvested products and transporting the livestock she raises to the Acostambo market on Fridays where she earns extra money with the sale of sheep and cattle she raises for many months.  She’d now like to have a business that produces still more extra income.

This is her second MFP loan.  In all this time she’s been responsible and punctual.  She enjoys being part of the “Tancar Puquio” association which is 
composed of mutually supportive people with enterprising spirits.  Yede will use the requested money to buy cattle and sheep for her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Moises Arahon

texts.es:
Moisés, necesita capital para invertirlo en su cultivo de maíz y de frijol , por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, para tener un mejor cultivo e incrementar la produccion, esto le permitira recibir una mejor cosecha para la venta y para la alimentacion de su familia.
El con el préstamo anterior le ayudo a la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y de frijol y con ello mejoro también sus ganancias y a podido ayudar a su familia en su hogar.
texts.en:
Moisés needs capital to invest in growing corn and beans, that's why he is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides, to have a better cultivation and to increase production. This will allow him to get a better harvest for sale and for feeding his family.

The previous loan helped him to buy agricultural supplies for growing corn and beans, and thus he also improved his earnings and he has been able to help his family in his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene, 33, has a common-law husband and four children who are in school. For the past seven years she has farmed vegetables in the Philippines.

Charlene has successfully taken out and repaid nine loans in the past through NWTF. She is now applying for a 13,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She wants to make and save money so she can expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 51 years old and married with seven children. Six of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Florencia has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms. Safia is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. Her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the daily expenses of the family members. 

Safia is contributing a lot to the family income through all her hard work. She beautifully makes embroidery patterns on the demand of customers. Safia receives orders for special occasions like wedding and parties. Her customers are satisfied due to her zealous work. 

In order to meet orders on time she requested a loan of PKR 30,000. It will help her to purchase various reels of thread and more packs of sequins, pearls and artificial stones for embellishment. Safia is very hopeful that this loan will enable her to complete orders on time and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase various reels of thread and more packs of sequins, pearls and artificial stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Grace Marie

texts.en:
This is Grace, 34, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Evrich, a seaman and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Grace operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Grace hopes to give her children a good life and dreams of expanding her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a debt with an informal moneylender and to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena, 33, is married and has five children aged fourteen, eleven, ten, seven and three years. For the past fifteen years she has made and sold charcoal. She also sells copra, the dried meat of a coconut.

Maria Elena is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy more sacks to hold her charcoal and copra, more wood for her charcoal fire and more copra to sell. Her motivation is to support her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy sacks, wood and copra.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is a weaver and assists her husband in their farming business. Her husband is farmer and does a fishing business when he is free. They live in a village across the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

La is asking for a loan of $300 in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for the renewal works at his mini-market.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 47, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually support her family.

Rosario operates a flower decoration business. This kind of business is in demand for wedding, birthday, anniversary and other special occasions and gatherings. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more types of flowers and to buy equipment to maintain the beauty of the flowers, and also to buy food ingredients for the canteen. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosario hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different flower decor that she will need in her business.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally (in the photo) and her husband, Lieng are farmers. When free from the farming business, she also weaves silk at home. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. One is married and lives outside family home, two are garment workers, one is a weaver another one is a construction worker and another one attends school. The family lives along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phally had asked and used her previous loan to purchase a motorbike for her son, the garment worker, to drive to work.  

She is now applying for another loan in the amount of $1,500 to assist in her farming by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To assist in her farming by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es:
Ana, continúa trabajando y actualmente necesita compararse pintura y mandar arreglar el coche en el cual se realiza sus ventas, además se le enviará al mecánico para crear algunas reparaciones para que esté en buenas condiciones y ella pueda continuar ofreciendo sus productos, considera que es de vital importancia esta reparación ya que depende de este coche para el buen funcionamiento del negocio.

Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo al negocio ya que mejoró la disponibilidad de materiales hasta el momento ha mantenido sus ventas y los ingresos a su hogar, ayudándole a ir poco a poco mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ana continues working and now she needs to buy paint and fix the car she uses for her sales. Also, the car will be taken to the mechanic to make some repairs to be in good condition so she can continue offering her products. She thinks this repair is of vital importance because she depends on this car for the smooth running of her business.

She states that the previous loan had a positive effect on her business because it improved the availability of materials. So far, she has maintained her sales and the income for her home, helping her to gradually improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain her sales car.

loans.name: Humberto Mario

texts.es:
Humberto, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el cultivo de maíz, en esta ocasión se comprará dos sacos de abono, los cuales necesita para reforzar su cultivo y que éste le dé una mejor cosecha abundante y sana de la cual pueda alimentar a su familia y asimismo poder vender y generar ingresos.

Humberto considera que a través de sus préstamos se le ha permitido crecer en el trabajo agropecuario y tener todo lo necesario para poder trabajar la agricultura, sus condiciones familiares se han mantenido, hoy en día sus ingresos están estables.
texts.en:
Humberto has decided on a new loan to invest in cultivating corn, this time he will buy two sacks of fertilizer, which he needs to strengthen his crop so that it gives him a healthy and abundant harvest with which he can feed his family and also sell to generate income. 

Humberto believes that through his loans, he has been able to to grow in his agricultural work and have all the necessities to work in agriculture. His family has maintained their living conditions and nowadays their income is stable.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat is married and has six children aged 13, 14, 17, 18, 19 and 27 year old. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education.

Since her husband’s income was insufficient to provide the family with a good quality of life, Muhabat decided to start selling clothes to make money to support her family. She took a course called “To Get Ahead” offered by a women’s organization and so has learned enough to start her business.

Muhabat is requesting a loan of 3000 TJS through IMON to buy women clothes for her budding business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women clothes for her budding business.

loans.name: Davaadalai

texts.en:
Davaadalai is a 38-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Khuvsgul province, Mongolia. Her daughter is eighteen, her son is thirteen, and they both study at the secondary school.

Since her husband passed away ten years ago Davaadalai has worked in various jobs to cover expenses for her and her two children. She now rents a stall in the marketplace but is planning to open her own grocery shop. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan from XacBank to buy equipment and other necessary items to equip her shop.

Davaadalai is a powerful woman who says, "My children are bigger now and help me run our grocery stall. I am happy that Xacbank can provide me with helpful loans."

loans.use: to buy equipment and other necessary items to equip her shop.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 46-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Amina is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She has five years experience with her home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. 

Amina and her group has been already successful in the past on taking a group loan funded through Kiva. In the past Amina used her loan to buy a sewing machine, an overlock machine and some nice quality fabrics and raw materials. Having repaid the loan, she is now taking a new loan to buy an embroidery machine and some small furniture items for her work area.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and some small furniture items for her work area.

loans.name: Bitijuma

texts.en:
Bitijuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a shop selling used clothes. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from a retail shop. Her major business challenges are ever-increasing prices of used clothes and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Chnwr's Group

texts.en:
Chnwr is a 38-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Chnwr is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has six years experience with her home-based sewing and tailoring business activity which she is trying to improve now. With an established client base, she would like to focus on improving her own work experience and work conditions by renewing her work area. To pay for the renovation works she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to renew her work area.

loans.name: Hero's Group

texts.en:
Hero is a 46-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hero is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has four years experience with her home-based sewing and tailoring business where she makes custom-order dresses and other small fabric household items. Having built a nice customer base, she would like to improve her work conditions for a better work experience. To renew her work area and pay for the renovation works she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and pay for the renovation works.

loans.name: Bunroeung

texts.en:
Bunroeung, 58, is a widowed mother with three sons and one daughter. One is married and lives separately, two are electricians and another one is a weaver. The family lives along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Bunroeung is a rice farmer. When free from farming, she makes and sells typical Cambodian cakes in her village. She is asking for a loan of an amount of $1,500 to buy a new, motorized hand tiller because the old one is breaking.

loans.use: To buy a new, motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Biejkhal

texts.en:
Biejkhal is a 41-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Biejkhal is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Biejkhal has three years of experience with the home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. She would like to improve it by offering a greater variety of services to her customers by adding more creativity to her work. She took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq of an amount of 3,000 USD to buy a new embroidery machine and make improvements to her work area.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new embroidery machine and make improvements to her work area.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon (pictured) and her husband, Pheap, are rice farmers. In addition, Suon is also a weaver and her husband has a business of buying, raising, and selling cows. They live in a village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children - one son and three daughters. 

Suon had requested and used a previous loan to purchase an irrigation machine to spray her farm. 
 
She is now applying for another loan in the amount of $1,500 to assist in her farming, by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Rwnak's Group

texts.en:
Rwnak is a 55-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Rwnak is one of the many Iraqi woman who works from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and assist in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Rwnak has 24 years experience with her sewing and tailoring business which she has been working on improving for the past few years. She took a loan in the past, which she used to have her sewing machine repaired and to purchase a chair with a table and a cabinet for her work area. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, she has now taken a new loan to make further improvements. This time she would like to focus more on her work area and renew her work space. She will use the loan to pay for the renovation works which will allow her to work under better conditions.   

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation works which will allow her to work under better conditions.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохира жительница Яванского района. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Мохира вместе со всей семьей занимается животноводством. Она закупает телят, бычков, разводит несколько месяцев и продает по более выгодной цене. В этой области она три года. Также Мохира занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи на грядке. 
Мохира берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Mohira is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is 26 years old, married and has three children.  Mohira and her family are involved in animal husbandry.  She buys calves and bulls, fattens them up for a few months and sells then at a more advantageous price.  She has been in this field for three years.  Mohira is also involved in animal husbandry.  She grows vegetables.  Mohira is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Mavlyda

texts.ru: Мавлюда, женщина -предприниматель, которая имеет свой небольшой бизнес. Она у дома торгует продуктами питания. Магазин находиться во дворе её дома. У нее 4 взрослых детей, которые обзавелись семьями. Мавлюда – вдова. После смерти мужа ей пришлось поднимать детей одной. Начала свой бизнес с мелкой торговли. Мавлюда первый раз обратилась за кредитом в нашу организацию. Она не хочет быть зависимой и обузой, наоборот гордиться тем что может зарабатывать и помогать своим детям. На полученный кредит хочет купить продукты питания и  увеличить свой товарооборот. Она благодарна нашей организации за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Mavlyda is a woman-entrepreneur, who has a small business.  She sells food products at home.  The store is located in the yard of her home.  She has four adult children, who have families of their own.  Mavlyda is a widow.  She had to raise the children by herself after her husband's death.  She started her business with small sales.  This is Mavlyda's first time coming to our organization for a loan.  She does not want to be dependent or a burden on anyone and is proud that she can earn and help her children.  She wants to use this loan to purchase food products and increase her product turnover.  She is grateful to our organization for the financial help and support.

loans.use: to purchase food products and increase her product turnover

loans.name: Rabi

texts.ru: Раби удачно погасив свой кредит в том же месяце решил получить очередной. Так как начался сезон осенней обуви он хочет закупить новый ассортимент мужской обуви. Недавно он выдал свою дочь замуж и те сбережения которые у него были все ушло на это мероприятие. Поэтому он решил сразу получить кредит и обратился в МДО "Арванд" за финансовой поддержкой, так как сейчас начался сезон осенней обуви. Раби необходим кредит, чтобы  привезти мужскую обувь, так как у него есть заказ на приобретение обуви от постоянных клиентов. Он очень благодарен что с помощью таких организаций  может осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Rabi successfully repaid his last loan that same month and decided to obtain another one.  He wants to purchase a new selection of men's shoes because the autumn shoe season has started.  He recently married off his daughter, and his savings went toward this event.  This is why he decided to obtain a loan right away and came to MDO "Arvand" for financial support because the autumn shoe season has started.  Rabi needs a loan to bring in men's shoes because he has an order from regular customers for a shoe purchase.  He is very grateful that he can achieve his plans with the help of such organizations.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for the autumn season

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 47 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Yulino, con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa de su suegra desde hace 24 años. Durante 24 años dedicó su tiempo y esfuerzo en el trabajo de confección de zapatos para vestir y también para uniforme escolar. Sus diseños son únicos, pues ella trata siempre de estar a la moda, “de esa manera obtengo mayores ganancias”, afirma. En todo este tiempo de trabajo logró obtener máquinas propias, con las que acelera su trabajo. Todas las semana reparte al por mayor sus productos a la ciudad de Tingo maría, donde tiene muchos clientes. Es por eso que trabaja con personal estable, para que pueda acelerar la fabricación. Ahora desea mejorar y renovar las máquinas que posee para obtener mejores resultados. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le ayudó a mejorar en su negocio. Julia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de plantillas, cueros y demás materiales para la fabricación de los zapatos que ella sabe preparar.
texts.en:
Julia is 47 years old and is a modest woman. She lives with her husband Yulino, with whom she has three children. She takes care of them in her mother-in-law's house for 24 years. During 24 years, she dedicated her time and effort in the work of making dress shoes and also shoes for school uniform. Her designs are unique, because she always tries to stay fashionable. "Doing so, I get more profits", she says.  

In all this time working, she managed to get her own machines, with which she accelerates work. Every week, she distributes her products wholesale in the city of Tingo María, where she has many customers. That's why she works with stable staff, to help expedite production. Now she wants to improve and update the machines she has to obtain better results. 

This loan is the number four with MFP. She is grateful for the progress opportunity given by her previous loan. For this reason, she promises to be punctual in her installments, because it helped her to improve her business. Julia will invest the money in buying insoles, leather and other materials for making the shoes she knows how to produce.

loans.use: to buy insoles, leather and other materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Sang De Jesus Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SANG DE JESUS est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Fabei Blandine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Fabei Blandine est âgée de 60 ans et est une veuve. Fabei Blandine est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Fabei Blandine vit ensemble avec ses enfants, et assure leurs différentes charges. Fabei Blandine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis quinze ans, Fabei Blandine exerce comme activité, la vente de céréales (maïs, haricot) et d'igname ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Fabei Blandine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Fabei Blandine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SANG DE JESUS, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group SANG DE JESUS consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

The group’s representative is Fabei Blandine, whose hand is raised in the photo. Fabei Blandine, age 60, is a widowed mother of six dependent children who have all attended school. She lives with her children and supports their various needs. 

Fabei Blandine never attended school. For the past 15 years, she has been selling cereals (maize, beans) and yams. This allows her to support her family without much difficulty.  

To meet customer demand, Fabei Blandine wants to strengthen her stock and bolster her activity.  To that end, she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group SANG DE JESUS.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and yams for resale.

loans.name: Edin

texts.es: Edin, tiene la edad de 36 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere  comprar una vaca que va a mantener en finca  que es de su propiedad.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva, a su vez la vaca es de doble propósito, porque así puede tener la leche para la familia y vender las crías para hacer los pagos. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Edin,36, is married and has two children who are his top priority. He wants to buy a cow that he will keep on the farm, which he owns. He has worked the farm for several years and he wants to grow, and he wants his farm to be very productive. In turn, the cow has a dual purpose, because he can have milk for his family and sell the calves to make the payments. 

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not taken out other loans from state banks or cooperatives, but FUDECOSUR gave him the loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

He also wants to give his children the necessary education so that they can be prepared for the future and face life in an easier way.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, quiere surtir más el negocio de mariscos y pescados, hacerles también mejoras al coche con el que transporta la venta, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprarse camarones, pescados, frutas y verduras frescas, también pagar mecánico que le pueda revisar el coche, para que se lo deje en buen funcionamiento, ella considera que a través de esta nueva inversión estará teniendo una fuente de trabajo para un período de tiempo.

Con el crédito anterior hizo algunas mejoras en su negocio, en este tiempo ella considera que sus ventas han tenido un buen nivel en su familia sus condiciones se han mantenido ha logrado comprarse algunos artículos del hogar y esperan seguir mejorando a través de este deporte.
texts.en:
Rosa wants to stock her seafood business and to make improvements to the vehicle she uses for deliveries.  She is requesting a new loan to buy shrimp, fresh fruits and vegetables as well as to pay a mechanic to check her car and be sure it is running well.  She believes this investment will afford her a lot of work for a period of time.

With her previous loan, Rosa made improvements to her business.  At the current level of sales, she has been able to provide well for her family and buy some items for the home.  She hopes to continue making improvements through these means.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fresh fruits and vegetables and to pay a mechanic.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun (in the photo with her loom) and her husband Mom are farmers. In addition, Thoeun also weaves silk at home. They live in a village across the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, and another one is in school. 

Thoeun is asking for a loan of 500 USD in order to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her rice farm.

loans.name: Las Ovejas De Cristo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal las Ovejas de Cristo esta conformados por 11 integrantes, de los cuales existen 8 mujeres y tres varones, todos mayores de edad, padres y madres de familia  con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad estas personas son originaria de Malpaisillo lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Malpaisillo se caracteriza por ser un zona agrícola  en el cual se siembra maíz. Plátanos.  Estos integrantes se caracterizan por ser personas, trabajadoras, responsables en sus pagos ya que cumplen en tiempo y forma. Estas personas se unieron para optar al crédito aunque todas tienen diferentes actividades se apoyan mutuamente. En el caso de Reyna Elizabeth ella es la coordinadora del banco y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva, ubicado en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante mercadería que ofrece  a clientes fijos y eventuales. El préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar ropa como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, camisetas, ropa interior, juegos de ropa de cama. El banco comunal las  Ovejas de Cristo agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The “Ovejas de Cristo” (Sheep of Christ) communal bank is made up of 11 members, including eight women and three men. All are mothers and fathers of families and are responsible for a total of 20 children. They are from Malpaisillo, which is located in the north of the country. Malpaisillo is known for being an agricultural zone where corn and bananas are grown. These members are known for being hard- working, responsible people who pay their loans on time and schedule. These members joined together to request a loan and although they each have a different business, they mutually support each other. In Reyna Elizabeth’s case, she is the coordinator for the bank and has a clothing sales business located in her house and she sells by foot to fixed clients and the public.  The loan she is requesting is to buy clothing, like pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, undershirts, underwear, bed sheet sets. The “Ovejas de Cristo” communal bank is grateful for the help the Kiva investors provide to people with little recourse in countries like Nicaragua, so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: buy and sell new clothes, like pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, undershirts, underwear and bed sheet sets.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (in the photo with her pigpen) raises pig at home, while her husband sells piglets. He buys piglets from fellow villagers and sells in other districts.  In addition, Chanthy is also a weaver. 

Chanthy and her husband live in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two are in school and another is still young. 

Chanthy is asking for a loan of $800 to expand her pig farming business by purchasing more piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: to assist in her pig farming business by purchasing more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Nermin's Group

texts.en:
Nermin is a 41-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nermin is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 7 years experience with the home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. She would like to improve her work conditions and renew her work area to have a better work experience as she creates custom-order dresses and small fabric household items. To be able to pay for the renovation work, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation work on her work area

loans.name: Jose Manrique

texts.es:
José, continúa trabajando en la venta de mariscos, también en el negocio con su taller, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en algunos productos frescos como son camarones y pescado, también invertirá en repuestos para la reparación de vehículos como luces, bujías y otros accesorios que le permitan continuar trabajando como motorista, él considera que se ha mantenido trabajando en estos meses y eso le ha dado la facilidad económica para su familia.

Ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, ya que le permitió los recursos necesarios para realizar un buen trabajo y en su familia todos se encuentran bien y considera que ha reducido un poco las ganancias dándole la iniciativa de dedicar más tiempo a la venta de mariscos para poder crecer nuevamente en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José has continued to work both in the sale of seafood and at his car shop. He is requesting a new loan to invest in fresh products such as seafood and fish, and also to invest in spare vehicle parts, such as bulbs and spark plugs, among other accessories that will allow him to keep working as a mechanic. He believes that he has been working a lot these past months and this has given financial ease to his family.

The previous loan had a positive effect on him as it allowed him to have the necessary resources to do a good job. In his family, everyone is doing well.  However, José feels that the profits from his businesses have been falling. This has given him the initiative to invest more time in the sale of seafood, which will allow him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Cerveau Group

texts.fr: CERVEAU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même zone au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Charlotte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Jonas. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Charlotte et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Charlotte a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Charlotte vend des produits divers (riz, huile végétale, haricot) à son domicile. Charlotte exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Charlotte s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Charlotte sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe CERVEAU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Cerveau is a group with three members, who all live in the same area in Benin. The group’s representative is called Charlotte, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Charlotte is 37 years of age, and is married to Jonas. The couple has five children, all at school and under their care. Charlotte and her husband live together with their children, and ensure that the children are provided for. 

Charlotte stopped attending school during her high school studies. For almost five years she has worked selling various products (rice, vegetable oil, beans) from home. She is passionate about her business, and it allows her to provide for herself and for her children. 

Charlotte gets her supplies in Benin. As she wants to ensure customer satisfaction and increase her working capital, she has requested a fourth loan along with the other members of the Cerveau group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ requests, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Irene Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Irene Azucena trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 5 años como responsable de una escuela de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar, es madre soltera.

Actualmente es el segundo crédito que solicita a ceprodel para mejoras de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo y separación de cuartos y cocina con la compra de zinc, cemento, perlines y pago de mano de obra para otorgarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Irene esta en su puesto de trabajo donde planifica y prepara las actividades para sus maestros a cargo de ejecutar las orientaciones
texts.en:
Irene Azucena has worked for a public school in the municipality of  Paz Centro for 5 years, as the responsible of the primary school. She is in charge of planning and preparing orientation activities for the teachers. With this job she has been able to provide her family with education, food and the other basic necessities. She is a single mother and has two children.  

Irene is requesting this loan to make improvements to her home. She wants to repair the roof and wants to change the separation of the rooms and the kitchen. In order to do this, she needs to purchase tiles, cement, beams and pay for the labor. This will allow her to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and tiles.

loans.name: Felix Octavio

texts.es:
Félix, desea incrementar la mercadería en su negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad como maíz, frijol, azúcar, arroz, aceite, bebidas refrescantes, galletas y demás productos que necesita en su negocio para una mejor variación hacia sus clientes.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a generar más ganancias ya que pudo abrir un nuevo negocio en otro municipio, y así ha logrado sostenerse mejor económicamente él y su familia.
texts.en:
Félix wants to increase the merchandise in his business. For this reason, he is applying for a new loan to purchase basic products such as corn, beans, sugar, rice, oil, soft drinks, crackers, and other products that he needs in his business in order to have a good variety for his customers.

He feels that the previous loan helped him to generate more earnings, since he was able to open a new business in another community, and thus he has succeeded in supporting himself and his family better financially.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, rice, oil, soft drinks, and crackers for his store.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en: Mr Bayarsaihan is 43 years old and lives with his wife and his 3 children in their own little house, in Hovd province in Mongolia. His wife works at the central hospital for the western part of Mongolia. 2 of his children study at university, and the younger one is a secondary school student. Mr.Bayarsaihan has been growing vegetables in his garden since 2010. He has also built a vegetable pit and bought 4 head of cattle this year. The production of milk per cow is 10 liters. He produces dairy products from the milk and sells them daily. He harvests grasses for his herd from the garden. He is a hardworking and sophisticated person. He is requesting 5,500,000 MNT to build a barn and to cover the expense of harvesting vegetables from his garden.

loans.use: To build a barn and to cover the expense of harvesting vegetables from his garden

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julian, de 56 años es un hombre tímido. Vive en compañía de su esposa Rosa, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas: Milagros a quien cuida en la casa que heredaron hace 30 años. El trabajo que desarrolla Julian, es la herrería, tiene 25 años de experiencia en la fabricación de puertas, picos, lampas y demás instrumentos de la agricultura a base de metal. Gusta mucho de su profesión, pues es una herencia de sus abuelos ya que la mayoría de los habitantes de la zona se dedican a esa actividad. “Mi pueblo es la cuna de la herrería”, comenta. Tiene muchos clientes en las zonas aledañas, por lo que su trabajo es conocido y comercializado con mucha frecuencia. Ahora desea seguir teniendo las fuerzas para trabajar en la actividad que más le agrada. Asimismo seguir en la agricultura y crianza de animales como vacas, ya que es la otra actividad a la que dedica su tiempo. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le ayudó a mejorar en su negocio. Julian, invertirá el dinero en la compra de fierros para realizar los trabajos de herrería y si el dinero le alcanza sembrará alfalfa para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en: Julian who is 56 years old, is a humble man.  He lives with his wife, Rosa.  They have 5 children but only live with one of them, Milagros, who they care for in the home they inherited 30 years ago.  Julian works as a blacksmith.  He has 25 years of experience making doors, picks, lamps and other metallic agricultural tools.  Julian really enjoys his profession; it was passed down to him from his grandparents.  The majority of the residents in his area make their livings in the same business.  He says, “My town is a blacksmith cradle.”  Julian has a lot of customers in the neighboring areas.  His work is well known and sells regularly.  Now he wants to continue to have the energy to work in the area that pleases him most.  He wants to keep working in agriculture and raising animals, like cattle, as well.  That's the other area he dedicates his time to.  This is Julian's fifth loan with MFP,  He is grateful for the opportunity to step forward that they offered him with his previous loans.  They helped him to improve his business, and so he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Julian will invest the money in the purchase of metal to keep working as a blacksmith, and if there is money left over, he will plant alfalfa to feed to his animals.

loans.use: to purchase metal to carry out his work as a blacksmith.

loans.name: Henry Ely

texts.es:
Henry, necesita capital para invertirlo en su cultivo de maíz y de frijol, por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas para su cultivo y así asegurar su venta hacia sus clientes.
El nos comunica que el crédito anterior le ayudo en la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y de frijol y con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia económicamente ahora están mejor.
texts.en:
Henry needs capital to invest in his corn and beans crop. Because of this, he is requesting a new loan that he will use in the purchase of fertilizer and herbicides for his crops. This will assure his sales to his clients.

His previous loan helped him purchase agricultural supplies for planting corn and beans. With his earnings he was able to help his family and they are now in a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Elizabeth trabaja para una escuela en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 2 años como profesora de primaria, con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar.

Actualmente solicita un crédito para mejora de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo de la cocina con la compra de zinc, perlines, clavos y pago de mano de obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

En la foto Xiomara está rodeada de sus alumnos entre las edades de 12 – 14 años realizando un trabajo en grupo.
texts.en:
Xiomara Elizabeth has worked in a school in the municipality of Paz Centro for two years as a primary teacher. With this job she has been able to provide her family with education, food and the other necessities. Her family consists of her and her two children. 

She is currently requesting a loan to make improvements to her home. She wants to repair the roof and change the separation of the rooms and the kitchen. In order to do this, she needs to purchase tiles, cement, beams and pay for the labor. This provides a better quality of life for her children.

In the picture Xiomara is surrounded by her students of ages 12 to 14. They are doing a group assignment.

loans.use: compra de materiales de construcción zinc, cemento y otros

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Nora, de 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, a los que cuida en una casa que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años brinda el servicio de cochera en el terreno amplio de su esposo, cobra por el cuidado de los carros de acuerdo a su tamaño, por su parte su esposo también trabaja en esta actividad, ya que el negocio requiere de cuidar de manera permanente  y por la calidad de servicio que brinda  han aumentado la cantidad nuevos clientes; que acuden a su depósito para mantener sus carros seguros, adicionalmente a esto vende también carne de carnero de las cuales ella misma los beneficia para venderlas en carne ya que así es más rentable. Pero lo que más le agrada, es realizar este servicio de cochera  porque le permite realizar de manera paralela otro negocio para generarse mejores rentas en bienestar de los suyos y su deseo es  mejorar las condiciones de su cochera para mejorar la calidad de su  servicio. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le ayudó a mejorar en su negocio. Nora, invertirá el dinero en la compra de calaminas para mejorar la infraestructura de su depósito de carros.
texts.en: 43-year-old Nora lives with her husband and her four children, whom she cares for in a house she inherited from her parents. For the past four years she has provided carport services on her husband's large plot of land. She charges for watching over the cars according to their size. On his part, her husband is also in this line of work, since the business requires permanent attention. Because of the quality service they provide, they have been gaining more new customers who come to their carport in order to keep their cars safe. In addition, she also sells mutton meat. She slaughters the animals herself for selling, which makes it more profitable. However, what she enjoys most is providing this carport service, because it allows her to run another business on the side, so that she can obtain better profits for her family's sake. Her wish is to improve her carport's conditions so she can provide higher quality services. This is her second loan with MFP and she gives thanks for the opportunity to make progress that she got from her previous loan. For that reason she pledges to make her repayments in a timely fashion, because this helped her improve her business. Nora will use the money to buy corrugated iron in order to improve the infrastructure of her carport.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated iron in order to improve the infrastructure of her carport.

loans.name: Rosa Elsa

texts.es:
Rosa, considera que los prestamos son una herramienta de trabajo, que le ayudan a incrementar sus ingresos en el trabajo, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de concentrado y mas cerdos para engordar y luego comercializarlos para seguir generando ganancias y manteniendo a su familia.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior obtuvo más y mejores ganancias debido a que incremento sus cosechas de granos básicos, sus condiciones le han sido mejoradas, debido a que hoy su familia goza de una buena alimentación y facilidades de mejorar sus estudios y su negocio es mucho mas rentable.
texts.en:
Rosa believes that the loans are a work tool, that they help her increase income at work and this is why she’s requesting a new loan to buy feed and more pigs to fatten up for subsequent resale in order to continue earning profits and supporting her family.

She states that with the previous loan she obtained higher and better profits because she increased her basic grain crop yields; her living conditions have improved because now her family enjoys good nutrition and have better access to improve schooling.  Her business is much more profitable.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Sayda
